the business class cabin on Air Canada
787 is laid out on a one-to-one
configuration
meaning that every passenger has direct
aisle access I really like this cabin
the seat walls are relatively higher so
each seat feels very private yet because
of the 787's high ceiling the cabin
still feels very roomy the best seats
for couples are the two in the middle
they are separated by privacy screen and
logic would say that this could be
lowered however that's not the case this
is a fixed panel so let's just call
these semi couple seats the seats
themselves are excellent I found them
very comfortable with great support a
central control panel next to your seat
allows you to adjust all aspects of the
seat this includes internal seat
functions like lumber support just in
the headrest and the firmness of the
cushions there is also a massage
function but it was very light to the
point that I could hardly feel it as
expected there was plenty of legroom in
terms of storage there is a magazine
rack next to your feet and another space
under the armrest there is also a handy
Locker as part of the side console to
keep your phone and other small things
this is also where you find the
entertainment system remote the
universal power socket and USB port this
side panel also gives you plenty of room
to spread out the tray table is a good
design it has various positions allowing
you to easily get out of your seat when
it's in use this is aided by the fact
that the armrest can be load
in addition to the overhead lights there
is a private reading light just over
your shoulder once in the air I was
presented with the hottest hot towel
I've ever had then it was time for a
drink from the bar it turns out that Air
Canada's new signature cocktail features
both whiskey and gin with a top-up of
cranberry juice it would have been
criminal not to try it to my delight
it came with warm dark roasted nuts
